Therefore, the word "畾" is like a combination of thunder and lightning. See "畾".

In the later period, " Rain " was used as a symbol of inscriptions, because thunder and lightning often appeared in thunderstorms.

Oracle is used as the original meaning of thunder, and also used as names of people and places. Bronze writing is used as a person's name.

There are often so-called "thunder patterns" or "cloud and thunder patterns" on traditional bronzes, which are symbols that visualize the natural phenomenon of thunder with swirling lines. Similar patterns can also be seen in the writings. Thunder patterns are common. The use reflects the ancient people's worship of thunder. humanum_full_description:
「雷」小篆作「靁」，初文作「畾」，甲骨文及早期金文從一至四個車輪(◎)從「申」，「申」象閃電，車輪狀雷聲，古人以車輪行走的聲音譬喻隆隆的雷聲。故「畾」字象雷電交加之形。參見「畾」。

　　後期金文加從「雨」為義符，因為打雷閃電多出現於雷雨天氣。

　　甲骨文用作本義，表示打雷，又用作人名、地名。金文用為人名。

　　《說文》：「靁，陰陽薄動靁雨，生物者也。从雨，畾象回轉形。𩂩，古文靁。𤴐，古文靁。𩇓，籒文。靁閒有回；回，靁聲也。」

　　傳統的青銅器上常出現一些所謂「雷紋」或「雲雷紋」，是以一些迴旋的線條把打雷這自然現象圖象化的符號，類似的紋飾在籀文中亦可見到，雷紋的普遍使用，反映了古人對雷的崇拜。雷紋有時會單獨出現於器物之上，但主要用作背景紋飾，以襯托出其他如「饕餮」等主題。

Meaning Mnemonic
Rain on a rice paddy means only one thing... thunder! Get off the rice paddy! There's nothing but you to attract the thunder!
Imagine hearing the thunder as you run. It is getting closer.
Reading Mnemonic
You can't run fast enough to escape the thunder so you hitch a ride (らい) from someone driving by.
Thank goodness, that was a close one. The guy who picks you up is named Ryan, though he likes it if you call him Ry (らい).
